bill.title: Build Back Better Act Birth Through Five Child Care and Early Learning Entitlement Act Trade Adjustment Assistance Modernization Act of 2021
bill.description: To provide for reconciliation pursuant to title II of S. Con. Res. 14.

history.action: Introduced in House
The House Committee on the Budget reported an original measure, H. Rept. 117-130, by Mr. Yarmuth.
Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 94.

Rules Committee Resolution H. Res. 774 Reported to House. Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 5376 with 2 hours of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit. Measure will be considered read. Bill is closed to amendments.
Rule H. Res. 774 passed House.
Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 774. (consideration: CR H6375-6595)

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 5376 with 2 hours of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit. Measure will be considered read. Bill is closed to amendments.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with two hours of debate on H.R. 5376.
POSTPONED PROCEEDINGS - Pursuant to clause 1(c) of Rule XIX, further consideration of H.R. 5376 is postponed.
Considered as unfinished business. (consideration: CR H6615-6658)
DEBATE - Pursuant to H.Res 774, the House proceeded with further debate on H.R. 5376.
POSTPONED PROCEEDINGS - Pursuant to clause 1(c) of Rule XIX, further consideration of H.R. 5376 is postponed.
Pursuant to clause 1(c) of Rule XIX, the House resumed consideration of H.R. 5376.
Considered as unfinished business. (consideration: CR H6659-6667)
DEBATE - Pursuant to H.Res. 774, the House proceeded with further debate on H.R. 5376.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.
Mr. Brady moved to recommit to the Committee on the Budget. (text: CR H6665)
The previous question on the motion to recommit was ordered pursuant to clause 2(b) of rule XIX.
On motion to recommit Failed by the Yeas and Nays: 208 - 220 (Roll no. 384).
On passage Passed by the Yeas and Nays: 220 - 213 (Roll no. 385). (text: 11/18/2021 CR H6375-6576)
Motion to reconsider laid upon the table. Objection heard.
Mr. Neal moved to reconsider the vote.
Mr. McGovern moved to table the motion to reconsider the vote.
On motion to table the motion to reconsider Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 217 - 105 (Roll no. 386).
Motion to reconsider laid on the table.
Received in the Senate. Read the first time. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under Read the First Time.
Read the second time. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 464.
Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs. Hearings held.
Motion to proceed to consideration of measure agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 51 - 50. Record Vote Number: 287. (CR S4070)
Measure laid before Senate by motion. (consideration: CR S4070-4152, S4154-4164, S4168-4201)
Motion by Senator Scott FL, to commit to Senate Committee on Finance with instructions rejected in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 50 - 50. Record Vote Number: 297. (CR S4180)
Motion by Senator Collins to commit to Senate Committee on Finance with instructions rejected in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 50 - 50. Record Vote Number: 302. (CR S4183-4184)
Motion by Senator Rubio to commit to Senate Committee on the Judiciary with instructions rejected in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 50 - 50. Record Vote Number: 304. (CR S4184-4185)
Motion by Senator Scott SC, to commit to Senate Committee on Finance with instructions rejected in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 50 - 50. Record Vote Number: 307. (CR S4186)
Motion by Senator Cruz to commit to Senate Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs with instructions rejected in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 49 - 51. Record Vote Number: 315. (CR S4194)
Motion by Senator Cruz to commit to Senate Committee on the Judiciary with instructions rejected in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 50 - 50. Record Vote Number: 316. (CR S4194-4195)
Motion by Senator Hoeven to commit to Senate Committee on Finance with instructions rejected in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 50 - 50. Record Vote Number: 317. (CR S4195)
Motion by Senator Blackburn to commit to Senate Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry with instructions rejected in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 50 - 50. Record Vote Number: 318. (CR S4196)
Motion by Senator Rubio to commit to Senate Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions with instructions rejected in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 50 - 50. Record Vote Number: 319. (CR S4196-4197)
Motion by Senator Hagerty to commit to Senate Committee on the Judiciary with instructions rejected in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 50 - 50. Record Vote Number: 322. (CR S4199)
S.Amdt.5418 Amendment SA 5418 proposed by Senator Shelby to Amendment SA 5194. (consideration: CR S4186; text: CR S4186) To end the President's War on Coal through the approval of coal leases.
S.Amdt.5409 Amendment SA 5409 not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 50 - 50. Record Vote Number: 291.

S.Amdt.5409 Amendment SA 5409 proposed by Senator Barrasso to Amendment SA 5194. (consideration: CR S4172; text: CR S4172) To require certain additional onshore oil and gas lease sales in certain states.

S.Amdt.5421 Amendment SA 5421 proposed by Senator Grassley to Amendment SA 5194. (consideration: CR S4183; text: CR S4339-4341) To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to modify the maximum capital gains tax rate, to provide a partial exclusion for interest received by individuals, to provide inflation adjustments for certain tax benefits, and for other purposes.
S.Amdt.5421 Amendment SA 5421 not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 49 - 51. Record Vote Number: 301.
S.Amdt.5404 Amendment SA 5404 not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 50 - 50. Record Vote Number: 296.
S.Amdt.5418 Amendment SA 5418 not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 50 - 50. Record Vote Number: 306.

S.Amdt.5389 Amendment SA 5389 proposed by Senator Marshall to Amendment SA 5194. (consideration: CR S4181; text: CR S4181) To protect patient access to current and future treatments for a range of serious conditions, such as cancer, Alzheimer's disease, HIV/AIDS, Parkinson's disease, and sickle cell disease, among numerous others.
S.Amdt.5385 Amendment SA 5385 not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 50 - 50. Record Vote Number: 313.

S.Amdt.5385 Amendment SA 5385 proposed by Senator Kennedy to Amendment SA 5194. (consideration: CR S4192-4193; text: CR S4192-4193) To provide for discounted insulin for low- and middle-income Americans.
S.Amdt.5384 Amendment SA 5384 not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 50 - 50. Record Vote Number: 294.
S.Amdt.5387 Amendment SA 5387 proposed by Senator Kennedy to Amendment SA 5194. (consideration: CR S4184; text: CR S4184) To require oil and gas lease sales in the outer Continental Shelf.
S.Amdt.5387 Amendment SA 5387 not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 50 - 50. Record Vote Number: 303.
S.Amdt.5389 Amendment SA 5389 not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 50 - 50. Record Vote Number: 298.

S.Amdt.5435 Amendment SA 5435 proposed by Senator Sullivan to Amendment SA 5194. (consideration: CR S4197; text: CR S4197) To replace the funding for the Office of the Chief Readiness Support Officer with a $500,000,000 appropriation for the construction or improvement of primary pedestrian fencing and barriers along the southwest border.

S.Amdt.5404 Amendment SA 5404 proposed by Senator Crapo to Amendment SA 5194. (consideration: CR S4180; text: CR S4180) To prevent the use of additional Internal Revenue Service Funds from being used for audits of taxpayers with taxable incomes below $400,000 in order to protect low- and middle-income earning American taxpayers from an onslaught of audits from an army of new Internal Revenue Service auditors funded by an unprecedented, nearly $80,000,000,000, infusion of new funds.
S.Amdt.5469 Point of order that the amendment violates section 4106, H. Con. Res. 71, 115th Congress, raised in Senate with respect to amendment SA 5469.
S.Amdt.5480 Amendment SA 5480 ruled out of order by the chair.
S.Amdt.5480 Motion to waive all applicable budgetary discipline with respect to amendment SA 5480 rejected in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 56 - 44. Record Vote Number: 295.
S.Amdt.5487 Amendment SA 5487 proposed by Senator Daines for Senator Graham to Amendment SA 5194. (consideration: CR S4198-4199; text: CR S4397-4399) Of a perfecting nature.
S.Amdt.5487 Amendment SA 5487 not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 50 - 50. Record Vote Number: 321.
S.Amdt.5488 Amendment SA 5488 agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 51 - 50. Record Vote Number: 324.

S.Amdt.5488 Amendment SA 5488 proposed by Senator Warner to Amendment SA 5194. (consideration: CR S4200-4201; text: CR S4200) To strike the extension of the limitation on State and local taxes and extend the limitation on excess business losses of noncorporate taxpayers, and for other purposes.
S.Amdt.5480 Point of order that the amendment violates section 313 (b)(1)(A) of the CBA raised in Senate with respect to amendment SA 5480.

S.Amdt.5480 Amendment SA 5480 proposed by Senator Tester to Amendment SA 5194. (consideration: CR S4179-4180; text: CR S4179) To establish a procedure for terminating a determination by Surgeon General to suspend certain entries and imports from designated places.
S.Amdt.5384 Amendment SA 5384 proposed by Senator Lankford to Amendment SA 5194. (consideration: CR S4178-4179; text: CR S4179) To provide additional funding for implementation of title 42.
S.Amdt.5469 Amendment SA 5469 proposed by Senator Hassan to Amendment SA 5194. (consideration: CR S4171; text: CR S4171) To eliminate the reinstatement of Superfund taxes.
S.Amdt.5469 Motion to waive all applicable budgetary discipline with respect to amendment SA 5469 rejected in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 55 - 45. Record Vote Number: 290.
S.Amdt.5469 Amendment SA 5469 ruled out of order by the chair.
S.Amdt.5472 Amendment SA 5472 agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 57 - 43. Record Vote Number: 323.
S.Amdt.5472 Amendment SA 5472 proposed by Senator Thune to Amendment SA 5194. (consideration: CR S4199-4200; text: CR S4199) To remove harmful small business taxes, and for other purposes.
S.Amdt.5435 Amendment SA 5435 not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 50 - 50. Record Vote Number: 320.
S.Amdt.5262 Point of order that the amendment violates section 313(b)(1)(C) of the CBA raised in Senate with respect to amendment SA 5262.
S.Amdt.5383 Amendment SA 5383 ruled out of order by the chair.
S.Amdt.5265 Point of order that the amendment violates section 4106, H. Con. Res. 71, 115th Congress, raised in Senate with respect to amendment SA 5265.
S.Amdt.5265 Motion to waive all applicable budgetary discipline with respect to amendment SA 5265 rejected in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 54 - 46. Record Vote Number: 311.
S.Amdt.5265 Amendment SA 5265 ruled out of order by the chair.
S.Amdt.5263 Amendment SA 5263 not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 50 - 50. Record Vote Number: 309.

S.Amdt.5263 Amendment SA 5263 proposed by Senator Cruz to Amendment SA 5194. (consideration: CR S4190; text: CR S4190) To strike the $80,000,000,000 slush fund for the Internal Revenue Service to prevent the hiring of 87,000 new Internal Revenue Service employees that will surveil and audit the private account information and transaction data of innocent Americans and small businesses.

S.Amdt.5262 Amendment SA 5262 proposed by Senator Warnock to Amendment SA 5194. (consideration: CR S4190-4191; text: CR S4250-4252) To make health care coverage available to low-income adults in States that have not expanded Medicaid.
S.Amdt.5262 Motion to waive all applicable budgetary discipline with respect to amendment SA 5262 rejected in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 5 - 94. Record Vote Number: 310.
S.Amdt.5262 Amendment SA 5262 ruled out of order by the chair.
S.Amdt.5281 Amendment SA 5281 proposed by Senator Sanders to Amendment SA 5194. (consideration: CR S4192; text: CR S4257-4292) To modify the bill.

S.Amdt.5265 Amendment SA 5265 proposed by Senator Cruz to Amendment SA 5194. (consideration: CR S4191-4192; text: CR S4191) To provide for certain conditions on the export to China of crude oil from the Strategic Petroleum Reserve.
S.Amdt.5382 Amendment SA 5382 not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 50 - 50. Record Vote Number: 293.

S.Amdt.5383 Amendment SA 5383 proposed by Senator Capito to Amendment SA 5194. (consideration: CR S4182-4183; text: CR S4331-4334) To expedite consideration of permits and provide regulatory certainty for infrastructure and energy projects.
S.Amdt.5383 Point of order that the amendment violates section 313(b)(1)(D) of the CBA raised in Senate with respect to amendment SA 5383.
S.Amdt.5281 Amendment SA 5281 not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 1 - 99. Record Vote Number: 312.

S.Amdt.5382 Amendment SA 5382 proposed by Senator Capito to Amendment SA 5194. (consideration: CR S4178; text: CR S4178) To strike provisions concerning funding for certain activities under the Clean Air Act.
S.Amdt.5383 Motion to waive waive all applicable budgetary discipline with respect to amendment SA 5383 rejected in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 49 - 50. Record Vote Number: 300.

S.Amdt.5301 Amendment SA 5301 proposed by Senator Graham to Amendment SA 5194. (consideration: CR S4170-4171; text: CR S4170) To strike a tax increase that would result in higher consumer prices for gasoline, heating oil, and other energy sources for Americans earning less than $400,000 per year.
S.Amdt.5316 Amendment SA 5316 not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 49 - 51. Record Vote Number: 305.
S.Amdt.5301 Amendment SA 5301 not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 50 - 50. Record Vote Number: 289.

S.Amdt.5316 Amendment SA 5316 proposed by Senator Lee to Amendment SA 5194. (consideration: CR S4185-4186; text: CR S4185) To reduce funding for home energy performance-based, whole-house rebates and to provide funding for supplemental payments under the payments in lieu of taxes program.
Passed Senate with an amendment by Yea-Nay Vote. 51 - 50. Record Vote Number: 325.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Resolving differences -- House actions: On motion that the House agree to the Senate amendment Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 220 - 207 (Roll no. 420).
Mr. Yarmuth moved that the House agree to the Senate amendment. (consideration: CR H7577-7704)
Pursuant to the provisions of H.Res.1316, House proceeded with 3 hours of debate on the Yarmuth motion to agree to the Senate amendment to H.R. 5376.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.
On motion that the House agree to the Senate amendment Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 220 - 207 (Roll no. 420). (text: CR H7577-7646)
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Presented to President.
Signed by President.
Became Public Law No: 117-169.
